lead_paragraph: Four agency officers were embedded with the New York Police Department in the decade after 9/11, including one who helped conduct surveillance operations in the United States, according to a C.I.A. review.

headline.main: C.I.A. Report Finds Concerns With Ties to New York Police
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Sees Concerns on Ties to New York Police

abstract: Inspector general's report shows that four Central Intelligence Agency officers were embedded with New York Police Department in decade after 9/11, including one who helped conduct surveillance operations in United States; report raises several concerns about relationship between two organizations.
snippet: Four agency officers were embedded with the New York Police Department in the decade after 9/11, including one who helped conduct surveillance operations in the United States, according to a C.I.A. review.
